page.title: 04THE MARINA AT HATFIELD
page.content: HATFIELD MARINA WAS FORMED WHEN A SAND AND GRAVEL QUARRY FILLED UP OVERNIGHT DURING THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE M18 MOTORWAY.IT WAS THE SOUTH YORKSHIRE COUNTY COUNCIL'S FIRST RECREATIONAL PROJECT.IT WAS OFFICIALLY OPENED IN MARCH 1979 BUT THE FINAL STAGE OF CONSTRUCTION WAS NOT COMPLETED UNTIL 1984.THE MARINA STAFF ARE SPLIT INTO 3 GROUPS.PERMANENT STAFF INCLUDES ONE MANAGER,TWO ASSISTANT MANAGERS AND AN ATTENDANT.THERE ARE TWO CLEANERS AND A RECEPTIONIST WHO WORK PART TIME.EXTRA STAFF ARE EMPLOYED IN THE SUMMER.EVERY 6 MONTHS A PERSON FROM THE Y.T.S. IS TAKEN ON.THE MARINA OFFERS MANY FACILITIES.THESE INCLUDE CAMPING & CARAVANING,BOARD SAILING,SAILING, CANOEING,SUB AQUA,SCENIC WALKS,PICNICS AND CHANGING FACILITIES FOR TRAINING RUNNERS.THE MARINA ALSO OFFERS COURSE WORK & TUITION.
